Lafcadio Hearn was born on June 27, 1850, in and on the Greek island of Lefkada. His father, Charles Bush Hearn, was an Irish surgeon in the British army, and his mother, Rosa Antoniou Kassimati, was a Greek woman. The profession of his father suggests a middle-class background, as surgeons during this time were typically considered skilled professionals but not part of the elite. His mother's family was from the mercantile class, further supporting a middle-class classification. 

Hearn was sent to live in Dublin, Ireland, with his great-aunt following his parents' divorce and his mother's subsequent remarriage. His great-aunt was wealthy, but upon her death, Hearn was left in the care of a guardian who mismanaged his inheritance, leaving him in poverty. Despite this, Hearn was able to attend a boarding school in England due to the initial wealth of his great-aunt, indicating some level of inherited privilege, at least in his early years.
